item.title: Marvel Rivals Player Shares More Incredible Stop Motion Animations of MVP Screens
item.description:
Marvel Rivals fan and Reddit user, MarvelousStopMotions, has once again attracted the interest of the game's community, courtesy of their new stop-motion clips featuring The Fantastic Four. Being a popular superhero team, The Fantastic Four was added to Marvel Rivals in early 2025 after much anticipation.

Back in January, Mr Fantastic and Invisible Woman joined the roster when the first season of Marvel Rivals kicked off. The next month saw the inclusion of The Human Torch and The Thing to finally complete The Fantastic Four lineup in the game. With the addition of these heroes came a bunch of new abilities, team-ups, and more for players to check out. Recently, one talented Marvel Rivals enthusiast gave a tribute to these characters in their own unique way and garnered a warm reception from other players in the process.

In a new Reddit post, MarvelousStopMotions shared their stop-motion clips depicting the MVP screens for Mr Fantastic, Invisible Woman, Human Torch, and The Thing in Marvel Rivals . Each of the four videos show a specific member of Marvel's first family in action in their iconic blue attire. The user revealed that the combined effort took them a total of 44 hours. The behind-the-scenes work involved in this stop-motion project is available on their YouTube channel. In the comments, several other Marvel Rivals players applauded the effort put in, with one user saying, "Amazing work! This is genuinely one of the best pieces of art I've seen in this subreddit."

Marvel Rivals Player Gives Fantastic Four's MVP Animations a Stop-Motion Portrayal

Notably, this instance marked MarvelousStopMotions's second foray into transforming Marvel Rivals MVP animations into stop-motion videos. A few months prior, the skilled artist had given the same treatment to other characters of the hero shooter title, including Spider-Man, Iron Man, Captain America, The Hulk, and Moon Knight. What's interesting here is that the user mentioned it took them 25 hours in total for these characters. In other words, the new stop-motion project apparently took almost 20 hours longer despite featuring one fewer character than the last time. Taking a guess, this might have to do with Mr Fantastic and Human Torch's MVP screens, which appear to be slightly more challenging to recreate.

Earlier in July, the MVP animation aspect in Marvel Rivals got a major change with the launch of Season 3: The Abyss Awakens. Following the update, MVP animations are no longer tied to their respective skins, enabling players to mix and match as per their liking. This afforded more room for customization for Marvel Rivals players, who had been asking for this particular tweak for a considerable time.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077: Achievement/Trophy Guide
item.description:
Players will not be in for an arduous undertaking for Cyberpunk 2077. Players will be able to get every trophy/achievement in the game on the game’s easiest difficulty, and they can make multiple manual saves to get them all completed in just a single playthrough.

However, players are unlikely to knock out this trophy/achievement hunt in under a week. It is best to make notes of which trophy/achievement will need players to make manual saves, and do all side missions they pass by to reduce the endgame grind. Plates that already played the game once can jump back to finish their cleanup thanks to all the new content added in post-release Updates.

All Trophies/Achievements in Cyberpunk 2077

Trophy Name

Description

How to Obtain

Never Fade Away

Unlock all Trophies.

Collect all other trophies for the game for this to trigger. This is only available for PlaySation players.

The World

Complete the main storyline.

This trophy/achievement will be unlocked naturally by playing through the main questline for the core game.

The Devil

Help Takemura avenge the death of Saburo Arasaka.

Make a manual save before playing through the Search and Destroy mission. During this mission, players must ensure they help Takemura safely escape. Make another manual save before playing through Nocturne OP55N1. Select the “risky but worth it” dialog option and complete the mission for this to trigger.

The Star

Leave Night City with the Aldecaldos.

Complete the quest line for Panam before playing the final mission of the game, Nocturne OP55N1. Select the following: “Gonna ask Panam for help”, “Take the omega blockers”, “Call Panam”, “Wanna live out whatever life I got left” and have V return to their body for this trophy to pop.

The Sun

Become a legend of the Afterlife.

Complete the quest line for Rogue before playing the final mission of the game, Nocturne OP55N1. Select the following dialogue choices: “Think you and Rogue should go”, Take Pseudoendotrizine”, “Goin' with Alt, you live on” and have V return to their body for this trophy to pop.

Temperance

Let Johnny Silverhand keep your body.

Complete the quest line for Panam before playing the final mission of the game, Nocturne OP55N1. Select the following: “Gonna ask Panam for help”, “Take the omega blockers”, “Call Panam”, “Body's Johnny's. I'll go” and have V stay behind.

Breathtaking

Collect all items that once belonged to Johnny Silverhand.

Collect all of Johnny’s gear and his car. This involves playing through Chippin’ In, Psychofan, Family Heirloom, and Tapeworm. If players kill Grayson, they can get the key to get Johnny’s car from his body. Johnny’s pants can be found in a suitcase in apartment 1702 during Pyschofan. The rest are reward items.

It’s Elementary

Complete all gigs and NCPD Scanner Hustles in Watson.

Complete all 28 of the gigs and all of the NCPD Scanner Hustles in the Watson district.

I Am The Law

Complete all Cyberpsycho Sightings.

Complete all 17 Cyber Psycho gigs. There are 6 in Watson, 2 in Pacifica, 3 in the Badlands, 2 in Santo Domingo, 2 in the City Center, and 2 in Heywood.

Greetings from Pacifica!

Complete all gigs and NCPD Scanner Hustles in Pacifica.

Complete all 3 of the gigs and all of the NCPD Scanner Hustles in the Pacifica district.

The Wasteland

Complete all gigs and NCPD Scanner Hustles in the Badlands.

Complete all 12 of the gigs and all of the NCPD Scanner Hustles in the Badlands.

Little Tokyo

Complete all gigs and NCPD Scanner Hustles in Westbrook.

Complete all 9 of the gigs and all of the NCPD Scanner Hustles in the Westbrook district.

Mean Streets

Complete all gigs and NCPD Scanner Hustles in Heywood.

Complete all 13 of the gigs and all of the NCPD Scanner Hustles in the Heywood district.

The Jungle

Complete all gigs and NCPD Scanner Hustles in Santo Domingo.

Complete all 13 of the gigs and all of the NCPD Scanner Hustles in the Santo Domingo district.

City Lights

Complete all gigs and NCPD Scanner Hustles in City Center.

Complete all 8 of the gigs and all of the NCPD Scanner Hustles in the City Center.

Full Body Conversion

Install at least one implant in each system and body part.

There are eleven spots for these implants. Have one in each of them and this will trigger.

Gun Fu

Kill or incapacitate 3 enemies in quick succession with a revolver or pistol in close combat.

Players will need a strong revolver or pistol, and then cause a commotion that can attract at least 3 enemies close enough together for players to then run out and kill all 3 at close range.

Christmas Tree Attack

Complete a Breach Protocol with a minimum of 3 daemons uploaded.

Players need to successfully complete a Breach Protocol with a minimum of three daemons uploaded in one attempt. This involves using the Breach Protocol quick hack on a surveillance camera or access point and correctly inputting the sequence of codes to activate the daemons

Ten out of Ten

Reach the max level in any skill.

Max out either Body, Intelligence, Reflexes, Technical, or Cool. Then max out one of the skills that is part of your chosen attribute. The 2.0 update changed how skills work, and progressing either Headhunter or Shinobi to level 60 are two of the easiest options using this update. The PlayStation 4 version of the game did not receive this update.

Gunslinger

Shoot an enemy grenade in midair with a revolver.

Players can use the Zetatech Sandevistan to slow down time to make shooting grenades with a revolver easier.

Two Heads, One Bullet

Kill or incapacitate 2 enemies with the same sniper rifle shot.

Align 2 enemies in a row and use a charged Tech sniper rifle to pierce through both of them.

Rough Landing

While Berserk cyberware is active, perform a Superhero Landing to kill or incapacitate 2 enemies.

Purchase Berserk cyberware from Ripperdocs. The location can differ depending on the player’s platform. Players will need to use this on 2 enemies that are nearby to get both of them.

Stanislavski’s Method

Use a dialogue option related to V’s life path 10 times.

Players will get special dialogue options to their chosen life choice. Select 10 of these options for this to trigger.

Autojock

Buy all vehicles available for purchase.

Use vendors or the computer in V’s apartment to buy all purchasable cars in the game.

Master Crafter

Craft 3 Legendary items.

For some platforms, players will need to first acquire the Edgerunner perk. This will let them craft legendary items. They can then craft these items after gaining the required materials. Other platforms, such as PS5 running Update 2.0 no longer require this perk, and just need players to amass the materials to craft 3 Legendary items.

Daemon In The Shell

Kill or incapacitate 3 enemies with one “Detonate Grenade” quickhack.

Players may want to save and then lower the difficulty to ensure all 3 enemies die while attempting to get this.

The Quick and the Dead

Kill or incapacitate 50 enemies while time is slowed.

There are several Cyberwares that can slow down time. Use any of them and kill enemies while time is slowed.

Must Be Rats

Perform the Distract Enemies quickhack 30 times without drawing attention to yourself.

Players that don’t like a stealthy playstyle can just distract the same enemy 30 times for this to trigger then go back to their usual approach of completing missions.

V for Vendetta

After reviving with Second Heart, kill or incapacitate the enemy who killed you within 5 seconds.

Acquire the Second Heart Cyberware. Weaken an enemy and let them kill you, then use the second wind to quickly finish them off for this to trigger.

True Soldier

Kill or incapacitate 300 enemies using ranged weapons.

This will unlock over the course of killing enemies with ranged weapons.

True Warrior

Kill or incapacitate 100 enemies using melee weapons.

This will unlock over the course of killing enemies with melee weapons.

Right Back At Ya

Kill or incapacitate an enemy who threw a grenade at you.

Enemies will occasionally throw grenades at you. Always be on the lookout for when this happens and quickly take out the enemy that does so.

The Wandering Fool

Find all the tarot graffiti for the job Fool on the Hill.

Collect all Tarot Graffiti collectibles.

Frequent Flyer

Find all fast travel dataterms.

Unlocks after collecting all fast travel points in the game.

Legend of The Afterlife

Reach max Street Cred.

To get a lot of cred, keep completing gigs, Scanner Hustles, and other objectives to raise street cred up to its max level of 50.

The Fool

Become a mercenary.

This trophy/achievement will be unlocked naturally by playing through the main questline for the core game.

The Lovers

Steal the top Relic.

This trophy/achievement will be unlocked naturally by playing through the main questline for the core game.

The Hermit

Find Alt Cunningham.

This trophy/achievement will be unlocked naturally by playing through the main questline for the core game.

The Wheel of Fortune

Interrogate Anders Hellman.

This trophy/achievement will be unlocked naturally by playing through the main questline for the core game.

The High Priestess

Talk with Hanako Arasaka.

This trophy/achievement will be unlocked naturally by playing through the main questline for the core game.

To Protect and Serve

Complete River Ward’s storyline.

Progress through all of River Ward’s quest line. There are 3 clues players need to find to avoid missing this trophy/achievement. These clues are in The Hunt. Make a manual save and ensure you get all three. The key to the nightstand is in the kitchen, analyze Randy’s computer for emails, and completing the braindance.

To Bad Decisions!

Complete Kerry Eurodyne’s storyline.

Complete Rogue’s storyline, then complete the following quests. Manually save before starting this quest line and after each quest to ensure you complete everything. The quests are as follows: Holdin’ On, Second Conflict, A, Rebel! Berel!, I don’t Wanna Hear It, Off the Leash, and Boat.

Judy vs Night City

Complete Judy Alvarez’s storyline.

Make your way through Judy Alverez’s Storyline. You will need to decline Maiko’s offer in the Pisces mission to ensure you complete this questline.

Life of the Road

Complete Panam Palmer’s storyline.

Complete Panam’s quest line. Make a manual save before playing through “Riders On The Storm” and ensure you escape and complete the chase scene.

Bushido and Chill

Watch Bushido X with Rogue.

Complete Blistering Love and progress the romance scene with Rogue for this to trigger. This quest is unlocked by completing Chippin’ In.

6 Images
6 Images
Cyberpunk 2077

item.title: How to Unlock All Prospectors in Wildgate
item.description:
Space pirating is no easy feat, but the Prospectors in Wildgate are bona fide professionals. Well, as professional as one can be as a pirate. Each one brings their own unique set of skills to the table, and if you want to come out on top, it's important to know who you're working with.

There are several Prospectors to check out in Wildgate and take on intergalactic adventures for glory and artifacts. Each of them comes with their own class and set of perks, making them suited to a particular pirating role. If you're looking to fill out the full roster of Prospectors in Wildgate , here's how to unlock all of them.

What are Prospectors in Wildgate?

Prospectors, a fancier name for swashbuckling space pirates, serve as your roster of playable characters in Wildgate . As an online multiplayer FPS, it's up to you to pick which Prospector you think suits not only your personal playstyle but the situation at hand. There may be a need for more defensive ranks or for someone adept at boarding enemy ships.

The game starts you out with a handful of playable options automatically unlocked, and as you participate in matches and level up, more members will unlock for you to try out and diversify your playstyle. Furthermore, even more Prospectors are slated to debut in future seasonal patches, according to the game's Post-Launch Content Plan.

How to Unlock All Prospectors in Wildgate

Since the game's initial launch, there are currently 7 playable Prospectors in Wildgate . They each have their own perks and traits that make them adaptable to various match scenarios, and understanding each of them will make it easier for you to balance out your team compositions and achieve victory.

Adrian

How to Unlock

Automatically available

Prospector Type

Raider

Perks

Jet Pack - Activate for a boost in speed (replaces Maghook)

Wings - Fly 30% faster

Health

100 HP

Venture

How to Unlock

Automatically available

Prospector Type

Explorer

Perks

Robot - Does not require Oxygen

Explorer - Regenerates health faster

Cameron - Warns Venture when an enemy is behind him

Health

100 HP

Kae

How to Unlock

Automatically available

Prospector Type

Boarder

Perks

Telekinetic - Can interact with objects 10m away

Warp Jump - Teleport once up to 100m away (replaces Maghook)

Health

100 HP

Sammo

How to Unlock

Reach Level 1 in the "HOPE" Adventure

Prospector Type

Ship Defender

Perks

Begone! - While on your ship, heal 100% after blasting a Prospector

The Quiet - See enemies inside your ship through walls - range 20m

HP

120 HP

Ion

How to Unlock

Reach Level 1 in the "DANGER" Adventure

Prospector Type

Boarder

Perks

Battering Ram - Melee attacks deal 2X damage and can destroy ship parts

Four Arms - Automatically reloads your stowed weapon

Health

120 HP

Mophs

How to Unlock

Reach Level 1 in the "GLORY" Adventure

Prospector Type

Boarder

Perks

Camouflage - Activate, moves faster, actions cancel, replace maghook, 15 second duration

Wings - Fly 30% faster

Health

80 HP

Sal

How to Unlock

Reach Level 1 in the "KNOWLEDGE" Adventure

Prospector Type

Engineer

Perks

Reflective Nanites - Multitool bounces to hit a second target

Salvage - Scrap unwanted items in Ship Processor, get random items or weird devices

Health

120 HP and no vulnerable spots

item.title: Wuchang Fallen Feathers: Where to Get Lustrous Red Feather
item.description:
Every Soulslike game offers players a variety of weapons to choose from, each with a distinct playstyle. As the game progresses, upgrading these weapons becomes a necessity, mainly to maintain damage output and bring down bosses more easily. In Wuchang: Fallen Feathers , defeating certain empowered enemies drops a Red Feather , which is an upgrade material that allows players to increase their Weapon Mastery. Here is everything you need to know about the location of the Lustrous Red Feather in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers .

Where to Get Lustrous Red Feather in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers

As the game progresses, you will find Faint Red Feather , Brilliant Red Feather , and Radiant Red Feather , which help upgrade your weapon to +9 at the Impetus Repository . Acquiring these items isn’t too difficult, as many can be obtained by defeating empowered enemies, looting certain items on the ground, and purchasing them from Wu Gang once you bring him more of his items. During the fourth region, players will find that their weapon is at +9 and requires a Lustrous Red Feather, but the upgrade material is nowhere in sight.

To acquire this, you must defeat the final boss of the fourth region and proceed to Bo Capital . After interacting with the shrine, you can teleport back to Annalum and from there head into the main courtyard. There should be a path on the left that allows you to walk along the wooden walkway . As the walkway ends, turn left and keep going down to find the Panda , who has now relocated here. Talk to it, and you can purchase the Lustrous Red Feather in exchange for 5 Bamboo Shoots.

In case you don’t have that many Bamboo Shoots or recently spent them on purchasing a different item from the Panda, worry not. You can still find one more Lustrous Red Feather, but for that, you’ll have to go back to Bo Capital .

Finding the Lustrous Red Feather in Bo Capital

From the Capital Entrance Shrine , turn around and look to your left to spot the entrance to a cave. Go there and head down the spine bridge until you come across what appears to be an elevator that goes down .

Upon reaching the ground area, you’ll spot a massive open space with multiple large enemies fighting in different corners. In the middle is a glowing white tree . Make your way to it, and go around the tree to find a white branch you can walk up . The Lustrous Red Feather is located at the top.

item.title: Call of Duty: Warzone Map Tier List
item.description:
The recent Season 5 teaser for Call of Duty: Warzone may be teasing the arrival of a brand-new map. Since last fall, many have theorized that Avalon would be the next map to come to the battle royale spin-off. Since the original launch back in 2020, Call of Duty: Warzone has featured several maps, and the potential arrival of a fresh one would be exciting.

Ahead of Warzone Season 5, taking a look back at the various maps that have been part of the game could offer a refresher of what locations the game has featured so far. If Avalon is added to Warzone , it would be an exciting shake-up, but only time will tell how it compares to past maps.

S-Tier: Best All Around

  • Verdansk

Regarded by many longtime Warzone players as the best Battle Royale map, Verdansk finally came back in April after years in the vault. What makes Verdansk such a strong design is that it's one of the most well-balanced of the Warzone maps. With its diverse POIs, Verdansk is a map that offers something for a variety of different players. From face-to-face combat lovers to those who prefer sniping, the map has locations that appeal to every fighting style. Superstore brings the action for close-quarters encounters, while Hospital is better for stealthier approaches. As the first map featured in the game, it holds a special place in a lot of players' hearts.

A-Tier: Close to Perfect, But Not Quite

  • Rebirth Island
  • Verdansk 84
  • Al Mazrah

There is debate about whether Rebirth Island has overstayed its welcome in Resurgence, but even if the mode is in need of a fresh map, that doesn't take away from the fact that it brings sweat-inducing action. Its reputation as a sweaty experience isn't for everyone, but the cramped nature of the map is great for those who love to be forced face-to-face with opponents. Verdansk 84 was a fun nostalgic addition to the game, but the sameness it shared with the original version kept it from being as exciting as it could be. The map was only around for less than a year, but it was an interesting attempt to bring back Verdansk in a fresh way.

Al Mazrah shared a few design similarities with Verdansk, as the two are centered around a central urban POI. However, Al Mazrah tried something different by not only increasing the size of the map, but making it visually unique, too. Al Mazrah is an eye-catching map, but it still lacks the overall gameplay versatility that continues to make Verdansk so beloved.

B-Tier: Fun, But Could Use Some Improvement

  • Fortune’s Keep
  • Ashika Island
  • Vondel
  • Urzikstan

These four maps boasted interesting concepts that held a lot of promise, but when it comes to the overall design, they didn't have the same kind of satisfying flow as S-Tier and A-Tier maps. Fortune's Keep and Vondel in particular suffered from camping problems. Ashika Island may be one of Warzone 's most visually appealing maps, but its layout also felt clunky at times, which could be frustrating. Urzikstan could potentially be A-Tier, but the overall design could have benefited from more POIs.

C-Tier: Far From Ideal Gameplay

  • Caldera
  • Area 99

Caldera is regarded by many as one of Warzone 's worst maps, with its strange design being much of the problem. From a giant mountain in the middle of the map to expanses of nothing of note between POIs, Caldera was a compelling idea that, unfortunately, failed to connect. Area 99's faults lie in many of its areas feeling the same, while the map also lacks sufficient cover, creating more of a frustrating experience for a lot of players than a fun one.
